Title: Mega Millions Jackpot Soars to $229 Million: No Winner Yet as Prize Rolls Over
Paragraphs: ['', '', 'Mega Millions: Jackpot Soars to $229 Million: No Winner Yet as Prize Rolls Over As excitement builds for the Mega Millions lottery, the jackpot has reached an estimated $229 million for the drawing on Tuesday, October 29. The latest draw on October 25 yielded no jackpot winners, with the drawn numbers being 23, 26, 35, 41, 43, and a Mega Ball of 7. This means that the prize will roll over, increasing the potential payout for the next drawing.', 'The Mega Millions has witnessed significant jackpots in recent months, including a staggering $1.1 billion prize awarded to a New Jersey player in March, which remains unclaimed. Should a lucky ticket holder emerge victorious in the upcoming draw, they have the option to take a cash lump sum of approximately $107.4 million before taxes.', 'For those eager to test their luck, Mega Millions tickets are available for $2 each at convenience stores, gas stations, and grocery stores in most states. In certain locations, such as Michigan, players can also purchase tickets online until 10:45 p.m. on the night of the draw. To play, participants select five numbers from a pool of 1 to 70 for the white balls and one number from 1 to 25 for the Mega Ball.', 'For an additional $1 per play, players can opt for the Megaplier, which multiplies non-jackpot winnings by 2x, 3x, 4x, or 5x—a popular choice among players looking to boost their potential prizes.', 'Mega Millions offers various prize tiers, from matching just the Mega Ball for a $2 win to matching all five white balls for a $1 million prize. The jackpot is awarded to players who correctly match all five white balls plus the Mega Ball. However, players should note that the odds of winning the Mega Millions jackpot are 1 in 302,575,350.', 'For those who participate, it’s essential to check the winning numbers and keep tickets safe. Title: Sugar Land retailer gets $1 million bonus for selling jackpot-winning Mega Millions ticket
Paragraphs: ['A photo of the Mega Millions jackpot-winning ticket worth $800 million that was purchased at a Murphy USA in Sugar Land, Texas. The store that sold the ticket received a $1 million.Courtesy Texas Lottery', 'Retailers get to share in the spoils whenever a Mega Millions jackpot is won.', 'Murphy USA 8848, located at 7520 Highway 90A, in Sugar Land was presented with a $1 million ceremonial check on Oct. 22 for selling a jackpot-winning Mega Millions ticket worth an estimated $800 million for the drawing on Sept. 10.', 'Representatives from the Texas Lottery and Murphy USA were in attendance to mark the celebration.', '“While most attention understandably focuses on our big winners, the Texas Lottery acknowledges the vital role retailers play in the continued success of our games and our mission to generate revenue for Texas public education and veterans’ services,” Ryan Mindell, executive director of the Texas Lottery, said in a statement. “Congratulations to the team at Murphy USA in Sugar Land for selling a jackpot-winning Mega Millions ticket!”', 'The $1 million payment was received under the Texas Lottery’s retailer bonus program, which awards 1% of the jackpot portion won in Texas up to $1 million.', 'Murphy USA stores across Texas sell and redeem Texas Lottery tickets, including popular games such as Mega Millions, Powerball, Lotto Texas, All or Nothing, Texas Two Step, Pick 3, Daily 4, Cash Five and scratch ticket games.', 'The $800 million jackpot was claimed by the Sol Living Trust of Sugar Land. The winning Quick Pick ticket matched all of the numbers drawn (1, 2, 16, 24, 66, Mega Ball 6).', 'The claimant opted to receive the cash value worth $409,297,624, before taxes, making it the largest prize ever paid out to a single Texas Lottery player. The $800 million jackpot also was the seventh largest prize in Mega Millions history.', 'The winning Mega Millions jackpot started as a $20 million prize on June 7 and rolled 27 times before being hit.', 'The Sol Living Trust is the Texas Lottery’s 15th Mega Millions jackpot winner and the first since Oct. 6, 2023. The previous win was secured by the Blue Yucca Trust, which scored a $360 million jackpot ticket in San Angelo.', 'The odds of hitting the Mega Millions jackpot are 1-in-302,575,350. A player who buys a $2 ticket has about a 1-in-12,607,306 chance to match five numbers and win at least $1 million, while the odds are 931,001-to-1 to win a third prize of at least $10,000.', 'Mega Millions starting jackpots and the rate at which the jackpot increases until won are established based on game sales and interest rates, with no fixed minimum amount. Players win the grand prize by matching five numbers from a set of white balls numbered 1 through 70 and one gold Mega Ball number from a set of balls numbered 1 through 25.', 'By choosing Megaplier for an additional $1, players can multiply their non-grand prize winnings by two, three, four or five times. Before each Mega Millions drawing, the Megaplier is drawn from a pool of 15 balls. Of those, five are marked with 2X, six with 3X, three with 4X and one with 5X.', 'All non-grand prizes are multiplied by the Megaplier number selected, meaning second-tier Match 5 prizes can range from $2 million to $5 million.', 'Mega Millions drawings are held each Tuesday and Friday in 45 states, plus Washington, D.C., and the U.S. Virgin Islands. Title: Mega Millions Players in Texas and Florida Win Big
Paragraphs: ['Lottery players in Florida and Texas each won prizes over $1 million on Tuesday after their tickets matched all five of the Mega Millions numbers, according to lottery officials in both states.', 'According to the Texas Lottery, a $1 million ticket was sold Tuesday at a convenience store in Austin, Texas, after a player matched the numbers, except for the final Mega Ball number.', 'A player in Florida won an even bigger prize in the same drawing, matching five numbers and the included Megaplier, for a prize of $3 million, according to the Florida Lottery.', 'The winning numbers for the Oct. 22 drawing were 8, 43, 48, 58, 60, and 4.', 'With nobody taking home the largest prize so far, the total annuitized jackpot has risen to $229 million for Friday’s drawing at 11 p.m., according to Mega Millions.', 'In September, a Texas player matched all 6 numbers with a four times Megaplier, scoring an $800 million jackpot.', 'In August, a Florida Lottery player in Panama City claimed a $1 million prize from a Scratch-Off game purchased at a convenience store. Josephine Galarza, 36, chose to take home a lump sum payment of $640,000, lottery officials said.', 'Changes are on the horizon for the Mega Millions who announced this week a “mega” overhaul to its popular game with larger prizes, better odds, and tickets that are more than twice the price.', 'In a statement on Monday, officials said tickets will jump from $2 to $5 in April 2025, the second price hike since the game first launched in 2002. The last adjustment was in 2017, when a $40 million starting jackpot was launched.', 'According to Joshua Johnston, lead director of the Mega Millions Consortium, the redesigned game is more exciting and will attract more players.', '“We are creating a game that both our existing players and people new to Mega Millions will love and get excited about playing,” he said.', 'Officials said players can also expect more billion-dollar jackpots than ever, faster growing jackpots, a built-in multiplier on every play to boost non-jackpot wins, and no “breakeven” prizes so wins always pay more than the ticket price.', 'The current game originated from the “The Big Game” in 1996 and was available for players in six states, including Illinois, Maryland, Michigan, Massachusetts, Georgia, and Virginia, before it was rebranded as Mega Millions in 2002 and grew to involve more states.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

First St., Suite 100, Austin, TX 78745.', 'And the winning numbers are 8, 43, 48, 58, 60 and 4.', 'The odds of winning $1,000,000 in the Mega Millions are one in 12,607,306.', 'The Mega Millions is the only game in the US that offers a second-tier prize as high as $5 million.', 'It is the only game that has awarded four jackpots over $1,000,000,000.', 'To win the jackpot, a player must correctly match all six numbers they select.', 'Five are selected from a pool of 70, and one "MegaBall" from a pool of 25.', 'However, there are a total of nine ways to claim a prize.', "As stated on Mega Millions' website, bear in mind these odds:", 'Overall chances of winning a prize: One in 24', 'Players who win big on lottery tickets typically have a choice to make: lump sum or annuity?', 'The two payout methods can impact how much money you get from your prize.', 'Annuities pay out slowly in increments, often over 30 years.', 'Lump sums pay all at once but in a smaller amount, as taxes are withheld in one go. That means 24% of your prize goes to Uncle Sam right away. Many states tax winnings as well.', 'Annuities can provide winners time to set up the financial infrastructure required to take in a life-changing amount of money, but lump sums have the benefit of being taxed only once.', "Inflation is also worth considering when making a choice, as payouts do not adjust with the value of a dollar. That means that you'll likely be getting less valuable money towards the end of an annuity.", 'Each state and game pays out prizes differently, so it’s best to check with your state’s lottery to confirm payment policies.
